page.title: 06West Kingsdown-urban sprawl
page.content:
{West Kingsdown}straddles the A20 just south of Brands Hatch. It consists of {low density two-storey houses and {bungalows.} Mainly built{post-war}the initial development was clearly in the inter-war years and is of a{"ribbon {development"}nature along the A20.
There is little of attraction in the village and a general lack of civic and social amenities. It is a typical {"dormitory town"}with little local employment, though a couple of{small {industrial estates}have been built in the past couple of years but the take-up in occupancy is no more than 50%.
Two buildings from an earlier era are evident in the village, the{Anglican {church}and the{windmill,}complete with sails.
